snippet: The Pre-Existing Condition Insurance Plan will be extended through March so patients can continue treatment while they find other coverage, the Obama administration said.
abstract: Obama administration says Pre-Existing Condition Insurance Plan, special insurance program for people with cancer, heart disease and other serious illnesses, will be extended for two additional months so patients can continue treatment while they search for other coverage; about 30,000 people are currently in program, essentially a high-risk pool sponsored by the federal government.
lead_paragraph: The Pre-Existing Condition Insurance Plan will be extended through March so patients can continue treatment while they find other coverage, the Obama administration said.
